lines.text: Miss Allen, is he coming here tonight, your friend Mr. Halliday?
Oh, well sure he's not coming here and do you know why he's not coming here tonight? Because he wasn't invited, that's why he's not coming here tonight, Lord Marshmallow.
Gracie, it's Marshmorton, not Marshmallow.
That's what I said, Marshmallow.
Look, Gracie, "marshmallow" is soft and mushy.
Oh, please, George! You don't know this gentleman well enough to say that about him.

[to Lord Marshmorton]
I'm sorry, would you explain that please?
Certainly. Miss Allen, have you ever seen a toasted marshmallow?
No, but I'm dying to see that. I bet you're a scream!

[Gracie answers the telephone]
It's a Hawaiian.
A Hawaiian?
Well he must be. He says he's Brown from The Morning Sun.
It's lots of fun having fun, even if you don't enjoy it!
What's today?
Oh, I don't know.
Well, you can tell if you look at that newspaper on your desk.
Oh, this is no help, George. It's yesterday's paper.
You know, if it weren't for two things you'd be a terrific dancer.
What's that?
Your feet.
